channel.title: Full Stack Developer
channel.description: Good links to all parts of the stack, even though that's a ridiculously large area. Bump.
channel.contentWarning: !!!WARNING: Please basically ignore this pathway. This is an ad hoc development pathway that I've been using to quickly test this system. The links contained within work but many times the "curator context" is comedically incomplete or wrong.

item.title: Step 1: Accessibility
item.description:
Objective: A broad but essential topic that should be considered in the early planning stages of any project and not treated as an afterthought. It takes more that passing some automated tests to have a good accessibility story. These resources will show you how.

  • A11Y Project (Required) - Read
    Learn the fundamentals and principles behind accessible design
    Context: Start here.
    Launch
  • Accessibility on Mozilla Developer Network (MDN) (Required) - Read
    Accessibility (often abbreviated to A11y ‚Äî as in, "a", then 11 characters, and then "y") in web development means enabling as many people as possible to use websites, even when those people's abilities are limited in some way. For many people, technology makes things easier. For people with disabilities, technology makes things possible. Accessibility means developing content to be as accessible as possible, no matter an individual's physical and cognitive abilities and how they access the web. The Web is fundamentally designed to work for all people, whatever their hardware, software, language, location, or ability. When the Web meets this goal, it is accessible to people with a diverse range of hearing, movement, sight, and cognitive ability. ‚Äì (W3C - Accessibility)
    Context: A wonderful resource that will take you far.
    Launch
  • Introduction to Web Accessibility | Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI) | W3C (Required) - read
    Accessibility resources free online from the international standards organization: W3C Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI).
    Launch

Pause and Reflect: - Can you add these practices to your work? - Ponder your own accessibility issues. How do you take advantage of accommodations?

item.title: Step 2: Security
item.description:
Objective: Stay safe. Put security first.

  • Diceware Passphrase Home (Required) - Read
    This page offers a better way to create a strong, yet easy to remember, passphrase for use with encryption and security programs. Weak passwords and passphrases are one of the most common flaws in computer security. Take a few minutes and learn how to do it right. The information presented here can be used by anyone. No background in cryptography or mathematics is required. Just follow the simple steps below.
    Context: Good tool.
    Launch
  • List of Emojis HEX/HTML Codes - DEV Community (Required) - Read
    Animal Emoji Animal Type Unicode Hex ... Tagged with webdev, emoji, hexcodes, html.
    Launch
  • Privacy Decrypted #4: Understanding anonymity vs. privacy | Proton (Required) - Read
    Anonymity is not the same thing as privacy, and confusing these two concepts can weaken your online security.
    Launch

item.title: Step 3: Back End
item.description:
Objective: Stuff for the backend from databases to ETL processes and basic OS stuff.

  • GitHub - bcgov/sso-keycloak (Required) - Read
    Contribute to bcgov/sso-keycloak development by creating an account on GitHub.
    Context: SSO DIY
    Launch
  • How to Set Up Nginx, MariaDB, and PHP with Docker Compose (Required) - Participate
    This guide shows you how to set up your LEMP (Nginx, MariaDB, PHP) stack easily and quickly using Docker Compose.
    Launch
  • Tutorial 0 - Get it RunningView (Required) - Listen
    Welcome to PostgREST! In this pre-tutorial we‚Äôre going to get things running so you can create your first simple API. PostgREST is a standalone web server which turns a PostgreSQL database into a RESTful API. It serves an API that is customized based on the structure of the underlying database.
    Context: Testing merging.
    Launch
  • Understanding GitHub Actions - GitHub Docs (Required) - Read
    Learn the basics of GitHub Actions, including core concepts and essential terminology.
    Context: Should be in it's own step practivally.
    Launch
  • REST Client - Visual Studio Marketplace (Required) - Read
    Extension for Visual Studio Code - REST Client for Visual Studio Code
    Launch
  • nginx (Required) - Read
    nginx ("engine x") is an HTTP web server, reverse proxy, content cache, load balancer, TCP/UDP proxy server, and mail proxy server. Originally written by Igor Sysoev and distributed under the 2-clause BSD License. Enterprise distributions, commercial support and training are available from F5, Inc.
    Launch
  • Azure AI Search-Retrieval-Augmented Generation | Microsoft Azure (Required) - Read
    Azure AI Search, formerly Azure Cognitive Search, is knowledge retrieval system GenAI applications powered byretrieval-augmented generation (RAG). Deliver the best AI experience to every user, at any scale.
    Context: We may get to use this so know what it is.
    Launch
  • Mojibake - Wikipedia (Required) - read
    Mojibake (Japanese: ÊñáÂ≠óÂåñ„Åë; IPA: [modÕ° ëibake], 'character transformation') is the garbled or gibberish text that is the result of text being decoded using an unintended character encoding.[1] The result is a systematic replacement of symbols with completely unrelated ones, often from a different writing system.
    Context: When you need to know this, also know the phrase "binary bridge method."
    Launch

item.title: Step 4: Front End
item.description:
Objective: All the client things. HTML, CSS, Javascript

  • Flexbox Froggy - A game for learning CSS flexbox (Required) - Participate
    Welcome to Flexbox Froggy, a game where you help Froggy and friends by writing CSS code! Guide this frog to the lilypad on the right by using the justify-content property, which aligns items horizontally.
    Context: Get good at understanding this and the world is your oyster.
    Launch
  • Tailwind Labs - YouTube (Required) - Watch
    We're a small team of developers and designers spread out all across the world, building tools that help other developers build better user interfaces. We cr...
    Context: Watch this!
    Launch
  • 10 ways to speed up web font loading (Required) - Watch
    Font loading can slow page load times significantly. This article shows you how to reduce the impact.
    Context: Performance is king.
    Launch
  • SimplePie Documentation: Documentation (Required) - Read
    A super-fast, easy-to-use, RSS and Atom parser written in PHP.
    Context: More tetsing
    Launch
  • </> htmx - high power tools for html (Required) - Read
    htmx gives you access to AJAX, CSS Transitions, WebSockets and Server Sent Events directly in HTML, using attributes, so you can build modern user interfaces with the simplicity and power of hypertext htmx is small (~14k min.gz‚Äôd), dependency-free, extendable, IE11 compatible & has reduced code base sizes by 67% when compared with react
    Context: Fun stuff.
    Launch
  • Testing dead link (Required) - Read
    This link should be dead.
    Context: Test
    Launch
  • systemfontstack (Required) - Read
    Webfonts were great when most computers only had a handful of good fonts pre-installed. Thanks to font creation and buying by Apple, Microsoft, Google, and other folks, most computers have good‚Äîno, great‚Äîfonts installed, and they're a great option if you want to not load a separate font.
    Context: BC Sans is cool and all...
    Launch
  • A Beginner's Guide to HTML, CSS, and JavaScript | HackerNoon (Required) - Read
    Unlock Your Web Development Potential with this Beginner's Guide to HTML, CSS, and JavaScript! Learn the Fundamentals and Create Stunning Websites.
    Launch
  • Semantics - MDN Web Docs Glossary: Definitions of Web-related terms | MDN (Required) - Read
    In programming, Semantics refers to the meaning of a piece of code ‚Äî for example "what effect does running that line of JavaScript have?", or "what purpose or role does that HTML element have" (rather than "what does it look like?".)
    Context: Learn this stuff deeply. Knowing how to structure HTML well will serve you well.
    Launch

item.title: Step 5: Misc
item.description:
Objective: Random links related to dev but not dev directly.

  • 5 Principles of Exceptional Case Studies in UX Portfolios | UX Tools (Required) - Read
    Principles to help you write unique and compelling UX Design case studies for your portfolio.
    Context: Because iut's good.
    Launch
  • Archivematica: open-source digital preservation system (Required) - Read
    Archivematica: open-source digital preservation system
    Context: It doesn't matter how good your system is for taking backups if you never try to restore from those backups.
    Launch
  • WakaTime - Dashboards for developers (Required) - Read
    Open source IDE plugins for programmers.
    Context: You might be asked to track how much time you're spending on different projects.
    Launch
  • Linux: An Introduction to User Management - The New Stack (Required) - Read
    Should you use useradd or adduser? This tutorial will teach you how to manage other users on your Linux machine.
    Context: Basics! Gotta learn it.
    Launch
  • Zotero | Your personal research assistant (Required) - Read
    Zotero is a free, easy-to-use tool to help you collect, organize, cite, and share research.
    Context: Might be cool I dunno ü§∑
    Launch
  • Download Government Marks - Province of British Columbia (Required) - Read
    Download provincial government marks (logos)
    Context: You're gonna need these.
    Launch
  • ChatGPT (Required) - read
    ChatGPT helps you get answers, find inspiration and be more productive. It is free to use and easy to try. Just ask and ChatGPT can help with writing, learning, brainstorming and more.
    Context: I mean, don't use it if it doesn't do anything for you, but I depend on this stuff.
    Launch
  • Mozilla ‚Äî Internet for people, not profit (Required) - read
    We‚Äôre working to put control of the internet back in the hands of the people using it.
    Launch

item.title: Step 6: Platforms
item.description:
Objective: All the different platforms where courses are hosted.

  • Just Ask! for Github organization access (Required) - Read
    Just Ask! A github app to just ask for Github organization access
    Launch
  • BC Developer Guide | A guide to application development for the B.C. government. | B.C. government DevHub (Required) - Read
    The B.C. government DevHub is a place to access common technical documentation, community knowledge bases, code samples and APIs.
    Context: Do yourself a favor and know this stuff.
    Launch
  • Common Hosted Single Sign-on (CSS) (Required) - Read
    The request process workflow tool for the RedHat SSO Dev Exchange service
    Context: We use this for Moodle and it should be preferred solution for SSO.
    Launch
  • PSA Learning System Homepage (Required) - Read
    Main registration platform for courses.
    Context: It's not the only game in town.
    Launch
  • Permalinks ‚Äî Eleventy (Required) - Read
    Permalinks ‚Äî Eleventy
    Context: Permalinks are more important than you might imagine.
    Launch
  • API Services Portal | API Directory (Required) - Read
    BC Gov API Directory Find an API and request an API key to get started
    Context: Use these where you can.
    Launch
